title: Maceo Parker - "Roots" (1990 - 2007) 4CD / R&B Sou
description:
Maceo Parker's funk bona fides are impressive - he shared the stage with the late James Brown and as part of George Clinton's Parliament / Funkadelic and Bootsy Collins' Rubber Band. 
On Ã¢â‚¬Å“Roots RevisitedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (1990) and Ã¢â‚¬Å“MoÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ RootsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (1991) Parker wails through some feel-good Soul-Jazz, Jazz-inflected R&B and Funk, flanked by a strong backup group that includes Pee Wee Ellis on tenor and trombonist Fred Wesley. Ã¢â‚¬Å“Roots & GroovesÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ (2007) finds Parker cutting loose with GermanyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s incredible WDR Big Band. Vol. 1 features a swinging Ray Charles tribute and Vol. 2, subtitled "Back to Funk," has the alto saxophonist and vocalist taking it to the bridge on the music he is famous for. The concept of playing hard funk with a brassy big band in tow is somewhat unusual, but the results smash all preconceptions.
